meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a stalagmite.
meanings.sent1: The stalagmitic rock formations in the cave were breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: The tour guide pointed out the stalagmitic structures hanging from the ceiling.
meanings.sent3: The stalagmitic shadows on the wall looked like frozen waterfalls.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, frozen in place, was stalagmitic in its appearance.
meanings.sent5: The stalagmitic crystals sparkled like diamonds in the dim light of the cave.

meanings.definition: Formed by the deposition of mineral matter from water, as a stalagmite.
meanings.sent1: The stalagmitic formations grew slowly over centuries.
meanings.sent2: The cave explorer marveled at the stalagmitic structures rising from the ground.
meanings.sent3: The stalagmitic growth on the cave floor looked like a miniature mountain range.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was stalagmitic, slowly building up over time.
meanings.sent5: The stalagmitic pillars seemed to defy gravity as they reached towards the ceiling.
